Question: It has been argued that this person conceived of his work at the Mint as a continuation of his alchemical work.
Hints: A statue of this person, looking at an apple at his feet, can be seen at the Oxford University Museum of Natural History.
When Robert Hooke criticised some of this person's ideas, this person was so offended that he withdrew from public debate.
The Cambridge psychologist Simon Baron-Cohen considers it "fairly certain" that this person had Asperger syndrome.
